snippet: After disputing reports that top editors had killed an article on China for political reasons, Bloomberg News suspended the reporter Michael Forsythe.
abstract: Michael Forsythe, reporter for Bloomberg News in Hong Kong who worked on unpublished investigative article on China, is suspended by his managers; Bloomberg employees claim that article, about Chinese tycoon and his ties to Communist Party, was killed by top editors because of fears Bloomberg would be expelled from China; Matthew Winkler, editor in chief, has denied article was killed.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY
byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Christine Haughney from New York.

lead_paragraph: After disputing reports that top editors had killed an article on China for political reasons, Bloomberg News suspended the reporter Michael Forsythe.

headline.main: Bloomberg News Suspends Reporter Whose Article on China Was Not Published
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg News Suspends Reporter Whose Article on China Was Not Published
